column5:
Thanks fellow warriors for the advice and support. I fortunately did see another doctor today and she actually didnâ€™t brush me off. She said it didnâ€™t sound like  anxiety (which Iâ€™ve been misdiagnosed with multiple times) and she asked the magic question â€œdo you feel tired after exercise?â€ YES. She took me seriously when I said â€œI need to lay down after vacuuming.â€ She took a lot of bloods, including glandular fever, Epstein Barr, ANA, ENA.. for those who have been through this, will those tests help with chronic fatigue diagnosis? 

I am very thankful to finally have a doctor who didnâ€™t brush me off or declare me depressed. Of course we are depressed. Not being able to do even half of what you used to do is depressing!

Iâ€™ve had time off work due to the lockdown and I actually like my job or did until fatigue made it near-impossible to keep doing, but itâ€™s been nice not to have the dread of â€œhow am I going to get through this dayâ€

I get this. Youâ€™re right; it doesnâ€™t feel like hyperventilation. Iâ€™m going to the doctor about it tomorrow because itâ€™s affecting me on a daily basis. The scary part for me is it can make me feel sleepy as well. Do you get other symptoms with it?

Thanks for the reminder that we just have to keep looking and stick it out until then. I try to remember that the worst day at work is still better than unemployment. We can dislike colleagues but as soon as we quit with nowhere else to go, theyâ€™ve won. It feels overwhelming when I see them 8 hrs a day but I try to remember that it doesnâ€™t matter what they think

Thank you for the helpful suggestion. 
To update: the doctor was appalling. He obviously had no experience with it, I told him what Iâ€™m going through, was in tears and he said â€œOK, so what do you want me to do?â€ Fatigue is not medically significant. I know you feel terrible but itâ€™s not the reason for people to stop workingâ€ I couldnâ€™t believe it. Iâ€™ve been a mess all day after it. Itâ€™s bad enough having this horrible thing and it feels like fighting for my life every day, and living with the reality of not being able to do all that I once did, then to be made to feel like itâ€™s no big deal. Itâ€™s just tiredness. Sorry for the trigger but I feel suicidal and so misunderstood. I feel like nobody could ever understand until they experienced this degree of tiredness for themselves. I donâ€™t know where to go from here, Iâ€™ve completely lost hope in any medical professional caring.

True... in fact that was when I had to admit to myself that I have chronic fatigue. Iâ€™ve had depression before and could still do my grocery shopping. Worried I wasnâ€™t going to have the energy to get my cart back to the car, empty it, and drive home was never part of depression. Itâ€™s very much an issue with this condition. I will be sure to mention that, thank you for the reminder

Iâ€™ve had fatigue for at least 2 years. Itâ€™s always been low level with periods of reprieve but a 38 hour work week is not possible for me anymore. I also have SjÃ¶grenâ€™s syndrome so Iâ€™m hoping that helps my case too. Not sure about POTS but my blood pressure is always low.
This is very helpful, and the step in the right direction that I desperately needed. Thank you â¤ï¸

Emotions / stress definitely exacerbates my symptoms. I assume theyâ€™re related. itâ€™s also a chicken and egg thing, I donâ€™t know whether Iâ€™m stressed because my body is hurting and Iâ€™m tired or if Iâ€™m tired and hurting because Iâ€™m stressed and unfortunately nobody can answer that. Iâ€™ve decided that our bodies are just sensitive to any stimulation of the nervous system. Controlling stress and changing my thinking patterns makes me feel in control of my physical symptoms even if itâ€™s just an illusion. Iâ€™m sure any stressor can certainly cause flares. It has helped me to use the flare as a sign itâ€™s time to practice more self-care. So rather than hate and dread the flare, I see it as an opportunity to slow down and be kind to myself.
I like this suggestion, Thankyou so much. Iâ€™ve found it takes the edge off the overwhelming noise. Yet to try weed â€”- heard itâ€™s good for pain though.

Thank you for sharing. Interesting about the tense muscles , in that case we may benefit from regular face massage to relax those muscles. My face feels tense and sometimes I feel like it may even LOOK tense. Itâ€™s so weird and uncomfortable to be constantly aware of ones own face like itâ€™s heavy or something.
Makes sense, thank you :)

Thanks so much for that link and your helpful reply. Itâ€™s more perceived swelling than actual swelling since nobody seems to notice it. I just feel the discomfort in my jaw and it makes me think itâ€™s swelling if that makes sense. Iâ€™ve had a dentist touch the area and they didnâ€™t say it was swollen. Iâ€™m fixated on it but nobody is the same both sides. My jaw looks slightly bigger on that side .

Thanks for your post. I completely relate. I wish you all the best returning to work, itâ€™s not easy but we are strong enough for it. It helps me to give myself a bit of credit  for the effort I have to put in every day, even if nobody else sees it or knows it. Oh sure they see the â€œshocking changeâ€ like you perfectly described. I hate when my boss says â€œBe your happy selfâ€ as if thatâ€™s my norm. Itâ€™s the act and itâ€™s exhausting, but like you I have my periods where being ON is relatively easy, and other times itâ€™s almost impossible.

I 100% believe in the gut bacteria connection. I had many years of bloating, cramping and intolerance to certain foods, extreme fatigue after eating certain foods particularly sugar and gluten and even though doctor tested for gluten and blood sugar issues, I wasnâ€™t convinced. I had severe fatigue. Then the fatigue progressed to joint pain and dry eyes and then came the SjÃ¶grens antibody positive test. Finally under the care of a naturopath who is focusing on my gut health and I hope this will undo some of the damage.

The truth is unless youâ€™re doing some great thing for God, preaching the Gospel and pose a real threat to the kingdom of darkness, he couldnâ€™t care less about you.

We had a young late 20â€™s pastor at my old church who actually refused to preach because he feared being â€œsmashedâ€ by the devil for weeks afterwards. 

But every time we give credit to Satan for anything, Iâ€™m sure heâ€™s happy to take it.

I can only offer advice based on my experience and with my last case of limerence with a co worker. Itâ€™s been almost 2 months now and Iâ€™m healing. Out of sight, out of mind is true. It will feel hard at first, like withdrawal, but then it lifts. Time heals all. Tell him if you really canâ€™t live without â€˜closureâ€™ but better best forgotten. I wish you all the best whatever you choose to do :)
Yep... a lot of inner work, however messy, and uncomfortable is the breakthrough for this dis-ease of the mind

I think â€œwhat do I want from this?â€ is a good place to start. I canâ€™t speak for you, but I know for myself, that the urge to disclose came from a belief that they like me back and are almost waiting for me to say something. When I have disclosed (once) that wasnâ€™t the case. Yes it got it off my chest, but it made me awful because my ego (which I believe drives a big part of Limerence) mourned that big time. 

As for my recent experience with the co worker, to be honest Iâ€™m still mourning it. Iâ€™ve gone into a depression over it. Nothing energises me now to go to work or be at work. And because he used to be there, and I still see his name on client files and notes and things in the computer, Iâ€™ve been having anxiety and sadness. The funny thing is I wanted him to leave because I wanted to focus again at work with no distractions. Classic case of careful what you wish for. 

Are you able to stay in contact with this guy outside work?

32 here. Same boat. Iâ€™ve not even had an actual relationship. Iâ€™ve realised that I couldnâ€™t notice if anyone available was genuinely interested in me, because I was too busy being hyper-focused on people who were flirtatious but unavailable or simply arenâ€™t interested, but my ego wouldnâ€™t let go and kept on hoping/ interpreting platonic signs as interest. 

It sucks. And yes it makes me ill too. My last LO dropped off the face of the earth a month ago, because he was just a co worker who left the company, and he left my social media requests unanswered and seeing him was my â€œhighâ€ so now Iâ€™m in an extreme low. I hate how much this affects our energy levels. Extreme high or extreme low, no in between. 

I wonâ€™t even log into Facebook at the moment because it would make me even more low to see he (probably) still hasnâ€™t accepted me and Iâ€™m still pending. So I havenâ€™t seen my friends updates or anything in the past three weeks because I canâ€™t face it. I feel like any normal person would say oh well and move on. 

As he was my co worker, I have been forced to take two weeks off work because I was having anxiety there. So now heâ€™s costing me money as well. Itâ€™s ridiculous. But a reminder that what we experience is far beyond a crush.

Limerence is horrible. Itâ€™s like we KNOW one person is not that special, because we can so easily become limerent over someone else, but the depression sets in anyway. 

Big hug â¤ï¸

My recent LO was a colleague who also just left the company so I empathise. 

I agree with no harm in speaking your truth. But I think the danger is in limerence causes us to exaggerate our importance in that personâ€™s mind. Itâ€™s always possible that they just donâ€™t care that much or wouldnâ€™t even say we are close to them. 

So as long as we deal with our expectations - as in making them null and void - we are only coming from a position of wanting closure for ourselves then allowing them (and ourselves) to move on. 

All the best.

Yeah 100%. Sure, someone would say limerence is not trauma. But the constant elevating of somebody at the cost of diminishing oneâ€™s own self worth is a traumatic experience. 

The mind/ body doesnâ€™t differentiate between different types of trauma. It doesnâ€™t categorise it the way people would, when they say â€œpeople have gone through worse than that.â€ My body/mind doesnâ€™t know â€œworse than that.â€  Funny, â€œhey you werenâ€™t in the warâ€ never turned off the stress response. Because no matter what the horrible ordeal is, the bodyâ€™s reaction is the same. So I never let people invalidate my experience. YES itâ€™s traumatic. Itâ€™s an awful place to be and we all know it.

Congratulations for surviving and making it out! (Yes thatâ€™s how I feel at this point. Iâ€™m in constant survival mode) 

I just got a doctors note and took two weeks off. Itâ€™s my sincere hope I can get another job. 

One of my coworkers who I vented to one late night shift went and told my boss... makes me feel very done with this place. You think co workers would be supportive but apparently he loves his job and told my boss that he was â€œoffendedâ€ that I didnâ€™t. Ugh.

Yes! Itâ€™s the small steps done consistently that lead to big changes. Well done! ğŸ‘ğŸ¼
It may not seem like much but it really is; because anxiety is so much about memories and when we have memories of being panicked and feeling incapable of just going to the grocery store, it will prevent us from trying. But when youâ€™ve done it, you now have the memory of succeeding. And you will again. Itâ€™s all about repetition and celebrating the â€˜smallâ€™ victories.

Iâ€™m going with not saying anything and looking for another job. It has gone on for so long and I donâ€™t have much hope for it turning around. If I was to get exposed as the â€œDobberâ€ as well, they would make the place more unpleasant than it already is. And what hope is there when the old people who are meant to be pulling the young people up, are commenting on their Instagram photos and trying to recapture their youth through them? Yep it sucks. Besides that, Iâ€™m losing my voice, and the will to live.

Ah I thought it was me. I have definitely noticed that I donâ€™t want to talk to people, at all, anymore. On my days off I just want to watch TV. I can see how easy it is to fall into a very unhealthy way of life. Seated all day then go home to lay in bed. I am always SO exhausted. Awesome.

Yeah I totally resonate with becoming someone who hates people. I used to be happy to talk to someone in the supermarket or somewhere but now I feel like it will kill me. When I get home I donâ€™t even want to talk to the people I live with and if a friend wants to talk on the phone? FORGET IT. Plus I can hear my work phone ringing when Iâ€™m in the shower now. Surely a sign of impending insanity!
Thanks for the advice, definitely what Iâ€™m planning to do! Iâ€™ve watched other people give their two weeks notice like a dog staring at a steak. :)

Hooray for quitting! I wish you all the best. Your supervisor sounds like mine: as long as she doesnâ€™t hear or see you all day sheâ€™s happy with you. Honestly itâ€™s like nobody wants to be bothered with anything and I havenâ€™t got the ability to deal with every problem that comes through. Iâ€™ve never worked where so many people were terribly unhappy. But I get it. I canâ€™t even relax when Iâ€™m not at work anymore. I took a holiday and all I could do was stress about having to go back to work. I donâ€™t think someone has to particularly love their job but nobody should dread it.

Nope doesnâ€™t sound strange and I think itâ€™s a good idea. But I know that even though the others slack off and the boss doesnâ€™t care, when I do it will be noticed. Iâ€™m not that lucky. I know I need to get out of there. Itâ€™s not going to get any better. I had a major anxiety attack just in time for lunch the other day which meant I couldnâ€™t even enjoy my downtime before I was back on the phone. Not worth it. All this job gives me anymore is money. And oddly enough thatâ€™s not enough to keep a person from severe depression. You need more than that.

Whoa, Iâ€™m sorry youâ€™ve had to deal with so much and thank you for disclosing. It makes my job sound like paradise, as my issues are with lazy staff who hate me, not with managers. But I relate to having to work through your dog dying- I just told the customer that my dog had died. I try to bring as much humanness to that desk as possible because I feel like a soulless robot.

Thank you so much for such helpful caring advice. I didnâ€™t know about the spoon theory but I talked to my roommate about it and she seemed to get it. But yes, I will certainly remember as well that I donâ€™t have to be feeling guilty about this. I have a busy job thatâ€™s understaffed and nobody is sitting at a desk dealing with what I do every day except me. Thanks again and all the best :)
That would definitely be a factor. High intensity emotional states cause fatigue. Anxiety is considered high intensity.

Anxiety itself is extremely exhausting, especially if youâ€™ve got it always hiding in the background even if youâ€™re still working and trying to fight it. The doctor said itâ€™s a tap leaking adrenaline all day so suddenly you get really tired. But are you also depressed?

Yes i experience this all the time at work. I have a boring desk job and it scares me how tired I can become out of nowhere. Then it will lift again. But itâ€™s the strangest thing and Iâ€™ve never been able to find a medical reason for it. It happens when Iâ€™m bored though and I think itâ€™s also depression.

The advice someone gave me once was to imagine them doing something gross and unbecoming. Seemed to work when I was desperately obsessed. 

Itâ€™s just a thought. Your brain is tricking you. Thatâ€™s why itâ€™s called fantasy. The reality is she is flawed and imperfect and would disappoint you and let you down and there are parts of her that arenâ€™t flattering. 

I would recommend not going to her gym , you are only feeding your obsession and giving into stalker tendencies is not good. Itâ€™s not going to diminish , the limerent brain cannot be trusted to be rational. We see these people in hyper-attractive light and the way to heal is to remove the images from your brain. Seeing her wonâ€™t help at all. Itâ€™s not closure; itâ€™s just your brain addicted to the limerence, fooling you into thinking this is going to be a good thing. It wonâ€™t be. Contact is a drug it must be starved of. 

I stalked an old LO at his gym, the coffee shop outside his gym actually with the fantasy he will come out and have coffee with me. The reality was he gave me a WTF face, and went on to his car, and I realised this guy is NOT in my life nor am I in his. I realised my own arrogance in thinking heâ€™s just got time to sit there with me that particular day anyway. I donâ€™t know his plans, Iâ€™m not privy to them because I am not in his circle. It was a harsh realisation that REAL friends plan to do things, they meet up, whereas stalkers just show up in the hope of connecting with that person which would be nothing more than a forced interaction anyway. This person does not have any plans with you. Put the shoe on the other foot and think how you would feel if someone you didnâ€™t care for was around a lot. Then donâ€™t do it to someone else. I had to remind myself of that harsh truth. 

We are irrelevant to these people no matter how much our fantasies tell us otherwise. Rather than go to work that day and get on with my life, I drove around crying for 4 hours, shaking. Limerence is a cruel bitch, donâ€™t elevate people who donâ€™t give you a second thought. Honestly. Stalking someone (and yes, it *is* stalking) will only make you feel worthless and will never produce the reaction you want from the LO anyway. Ever. 

All the best. You will overcome this.

Because the cross is a symbol of VICTORY. He wasnâ€™t murdered. The crucifixion was never referred to as murder. Jesus willing went to the cross for ME. For YOU. It is a symbol of Christâ€™s victory over Satan, over death, over sin. Satan hates the cross. And thatâ€™s why I love it. Jesus overcame the cross. Itâ€™s not a symbol of death, because he ainâ€™t dead no more.

Youâ€™re welcome. â¤ï¸ 
Iâ€™ve been here too often to not know how to regain some normalcy in thinking :)

Sounds familiar. It kinda helps to remind yourself that itâ€™s all chemical. It goes a long way in helping you to stop blaming yourself. If this conversation was between you and anybody else, you wouldnâ€™t interpret it the same way. It would just make sense that someone canâ€™t remember and leave it at that. It wouldnâ€™t consume you all day. You asked him a question, it doesnâ€™t mean he doesnâ€™t want to talk, thereâ€™s no opening there to begin some totally unrelated conversation. Us limerents look for any excuse to talk to LO and imagine they will be totally engrossed immediately. We canâ€™t just say â€œhiâ€ like normal conversation begins. 
I totally relate to thinking they donâ€™t want to talk. One of my past LOâ€™s injured himself and was in a neck brace and texted with me for 20 minutes before saying â€œhey thanks for the chat. Sorry but I canâ€™t keep texting it hurts my neck to look down.â€ And my stupid selfish limerent brain at the time went if he liked me if he cared blah blah blah he would have put up with the neck pain, he never would have ended the conversation, I hate him.  And I didnâ€™t talk to him for a week. Gave him very obvious immature silent treatment. Ha, crazy.  So yes I relate.

Thank you for taking the time. I wasnâ€™t even aware of disability accomodation. I recently found out my boss has a friend with lupus and her opinion on autoimmune illness etc is â€œperfectly controlled by diet.â€ Pfft. Right.

Thank you so much. I appreciate this post a lot. Thank you for sharing your experience honestly and openly. 

Itâ€™s funny how people think reporting back everything they hear will benefit you in some way but it really never could. 
I will look into the aqua therapy, especially since my new house has a pool! Thanks love â¤ï¸

Thank you so much for this message. I see a therapist but I donâ€™t even know how to bring up the limerence as a major contributing factor of the depression. I feel depressed and especially rejected after the FB stuff. Everyone accepts everyone on there so it feels even worse. Itâ€™s hard to have had some person be kind every day and to know now that it was probably insincere. That hurts a lot. He was so nice that I feel like I could never trust anyone to be honest about their real feelings about me ever again. Iâ€™m really torn up about the fb thing, and moreso because it feels stupid to be so upset about it. The thing is I donâ€™t even actually know if he ignored, declined or accepted. I have been too scared to even look. Iâ€™m just going by that heâ€™s not shown up on FB messenger. But I canâ€™t even bring myself to log in to Facebook and itâ€™s making me feel sick that he has that much power over me because itâ€™s possible he did accept, but also I know I would be gutted once itâ€™s confirmed he didnâ€™t. My limerence loves to live in the land of the unknown, instead of reality

Thatâ€™s awesome for you :) it takes courage to start that work in oneself. I experienced fatigue in the midst of limerence as well, especially after a high point followed by LO being distant (or just being normal, not doing anything I could interpret as reciprocation) 

itâ€™s starting to lift as I feel better. Itâ€™s because Iâ€™m accepting that LO is not my ultimate source of happiness and it was never ever his responsibility to be.
Emotions are very exhausting. I also think sleeping is a way of escaping confronting the pain of rejection, real or perceived, from LO.

So true. Sadly been there before to know it. Too bad all that â€œI know how this ends, it wonâ€™t matter soon enough as I will latch onto something better and think this LO is even more superior to the lastâ€ stuff doesnâ€™t register in the throes of the latest case of limerence.

Yep... and not being ready for it. Quitting anything takes thought and sacrifice and strength, but itâ€™s a different beast altogether when youâ€™re forced into it. As I said heâ€™s gone and doesnâ€™t want me in his life though the Facebook remark was a cruel sliver of hope that we didnâ€™t have to lose touch and I could still get a â€˜fix.â€™
Simple: The cross. Who would endure that if not for love?

Youâ€™re absolutely stunning. I can also tell you have a kind heart and care too much what people think. You should have all the confidence in the world. Iâ€™m a female inspired by your makeup skills. Iâ€™m sorry you donâ€™t see the beauty in you. Iâ€™m sorry that other people have been a big part of that. But living to please others will never work out. Iâ€™m older than you and I have been in your shoes. Whatâ€™s missing is your own self confidence. Nobody can give you that or take it away. You get that confidence by recognising your own strengths and accomplishments and honesty not giving a f*** if others donâ€™t see them or know them. When you are confident and happy within yourself, people know you donâ€™t need their approval so they know they donâ€™t have any power at all, over you. Yes youâ€™re more than your looks and itâ€™s not your job to make people see that. You just have to be confident of all the good qualities you have and stop worrying about people who only look at the outside and make judgments based on that. Because they will always be there. But happy, confident people - whether beautiful or average looking - always attract people to them. Itâ€™s an energy others want to be around. It starts with how you feel about you, first.

I canâ€™t stand that question either. If things were new I mightnâ€™t be so depressed?! My therapist taught me to turn the question back on them. â€œWhatâ€™s new with you?â€ Most people who arenâ€™t socially anxious or depressed etc like to talk about themselves anyway. Or say something humorous like â€œIâ€™ve taken a sudden interest in the fascinating world of plant biology.â€

Yes it sucks! I struggled with that until I started holding my breath whenever I felt that sensation (important to remember itâ€™s JUST a sensation. Itâ€™s uncomfortable but not catastrophic) until I couldnâ€™t hold it anymore. It actually resets your breathing plus proves to you that you have breath to hold. Someone who was struggling to breathe cannot hold their breath by choice. When you hold your breath until you no longer can, and breath out all that air, you will activate the part of your nervous system responsible for calming you down and prove to yourself that your body isnâ€™t going to make you hold your breath until you pass out, it is still in control, not the anxiety. It feels good to exhale! When we feel anxious we tend to breathe in deeper but that just makes you lightheaded. You actually need to exhale.

No problem, happy to help. Been there many times. A little secret: men who are unavailable immediately become more attractive to a woman. She may actually figure out what she wants faster if you cool it, than show her that youâ€™re the lost puppy that will keep coming back to her. If she is playing games however, this is someone who will be a nightmare if you had a relationship with her. Show her now that youâ€™ve got more going on, and know your worth. People play games to get a response. As a woman who has done this, the hoped for reaction when I showed up was all his attention, and when I disappeared for him to be sad and not posting on social media, etc. I wanted to see the impact I could have on him. Thatâ€™s not how you show care or love for somebody. This is not cool and not the behaviour of a well-adjusted person, just a scared little girl who needs attention. The guys eventually stopped reacting at all and left me on read and itâ€™s what my ego needed. Iâ€™m sorry to say it but I see myself in your description of this girl. There are girls out there who will treat you like a king- I know because Iâ€™ve lost every guy I played games with, to these queens. I wish you will find your queen, too.
Gossiping. Thatâ€™s one of the worst because it can keep people away from the Church, sadly.

She may genuinely miss you. The only way to gain some power back is to stop being so available. Make her work harder for your acknowledgment. Make your attention something of worth by not freely giving it. If she works harder for it, then she may actually like you. Or she may like the feeling you give her. So someone like this is usually a game player and itâ€™s best not to get attached. She sounds like a little girl. Real women donâ€™t play games, they just know what they want. People who play games just donâ€™t know what they want and hurt people in the process. When someone really likes you and wants you in their life you will never have to wonder where you stand.
CAAAAANâ€™T WAIT â¤ï¸

Bohemian Rhapsody

Gone Girl
Yes definitely. But self discipline is a skill like any other: it has to be learned then practised.

Good question. By accepting that youâ€™re a human being not a human doing. Your only job is to be, and being alive means youâ€™re going to have experiences good and bad and each of those is designed for you to learn what you need to learn to flourish in life. So when you understand that youâ€™re a human being, not expected to get it right all the time, you see everything that happens to you as a lesson. Youâ€™re a being and in just being is where your worth is, itâ€™s not in what you do. Once you realise that, youâ€™re free to live and learn and know that mistakes are all part of the human experience, they donâ€™t define you as a person. Not even your accomplishments define you. Rather than say â€œthis is positive and this is negativeâ€ I think of it all as part of the human experience and evolution. Donâ€™t attach so much importance to mistakes or achievements.
Thankyou so much for your time. I will sleep easy now with that thought in my head. Youâ€™re right; she says she applies for 30 jobs a week, hereâ€™s hoping!

Losing a pet is devastating. I faced that this year and cried for days thinking of this question. I found comfort and perhaps an answer in Romans 8:22 which says â€œFor we know that the whole creation groaneth and travaileth in pain together until now.â€ The whole creation suffered the consequences of a fallen world but has the hope of restoration, thatâ€™s what â€œuntil nowâ€ means. It doesnâ€™t say â€œall humankind groansâ€ but all creation. That includes animals. Itâ€™s a nice thought that God gave us these pets to teach us something about unconditional love. I donâ€™t believe they are meaningless to Him. There are scriptures about let everything that has breath praise God. God created everything to worship Him and God is glorified in the faithfulness, loyalty and love of a dog 100%.

Do you actually not want to go as you donâ€™t think you will have any fun or is it just because youâ€™re anxious? The first reason , then I would encourage you to think thereâ€™s no obligation to go to a Christmas party for work and leave it at that. We place way more importance on this than others. At parties people donâ€™t really care who didnâ€™t show up. The second reason I would encourage you to ask yourself what scares you and to not let fear stop you if you really want to go. Can you go home if you arenâ€™t comfortable? I have social anxiety and if I actually donâ€™t want to go I wonâ€™t. But if I want to go and am just worried about being anxious, I go. Because itâ€™s what I really wanted to do. You canâ€™t let fear of anxiety stop you from what you really want to do. Because it will keep happening and make your world very small and your social life non existent. Start with: Do I really want to go?

Donâ€™t burn with a lust from a distance. Right now you have a fantasy. You need to come back to reality by talking to her like a normal person because thatâ€™s what she is. 

When you let fantasy overcome you, you are at risk of seeing her as an object that you need to attain to be happy instead of trying to make a healthy connection with her by communicating and getting to know her. She will either reciprocate or reject you, but itâ€™s better than keeping your distance and this belief in your mind that everything about her is perfect getting stronger because itâ€™s simply not true. She is a human and flawed like everyone else and you canâ€™t know if you really like someone or if youâ€™re even compatible with them until you are close to them. From a distance they can be anything you want - which is actually what some people with a crush prefer so they will never try to get closer because they donâ€™t want to know who they really are because theyâ€™re in love with their idea of the person. But if you actually want a shot at this girl in real life, you need to be brave and take a risk.

Sadly people like to know youâ€™re there when they need someone. Itâ€™s not about you; its about them. You are probably a source of comfort because she knows you are available. In my experience people who do this are unstable. They like you but more for the feelings you give them not for you. They like that youâ€™re there. When people are feeling like they need somebody they will text and reach out to whoever is available. When they ghost you itâ€™s because they no longer have a void that needs to be filled. Something else has their attention now. I have learned to let go of those people and when they text I wait to text back or donâ€™t reply at all. You donâ€™t ghost people who mean something to you. Some people just like that youâ€™re available when they need you. But they donâ€™t care when you need them.

Absolutely normal and healthy and you should do it. You donâ€™t have to be with people to do so. You are more than able to revisit familiar places and the warm feelings you get from them without including other people. Itâ€™s when weâ€™re alone that we can do our best reflecting anyway. Ask yourself how you react when you read of some terrible crime. Maybe child or animal abuse or just unimaginable cruelty committed by someone. My response is anger and the need for justice. We are made in Godâ€™s image. He is a God of justice. He punishes evil. Plain and simple. People arenâ€™t created evil, it is a free will decision. If God had created robots , then He would be abusive for punishing sin because it was programmed for humans to sin. But He created humans with the freedom to choose between right and wrong. If You were the creator, You would reserve the right to punish bad and reward good. The God of the Bible is no different. It would be abusive and cruel if we couldnâ€™t differentiate between good and evil. But we can, and we have the free will to do either.  God is not responsible for what we choose to do with our free will. If you break the law, you go to jail. If you break Godâ€™s laws, there are also consequences.

God does not pardon sin and wrong doing. He gives us another chance. We give the people who do wrong by us another chance, but that doesnâ€™t mean we excuse the behaviour. God has not decided to never punish sin. Forgiveness doesnâ€™t make us a pushover. Forgiveness doesnâ€™t mean : I will allow you to walk all over me. Forgiveness is not weakness. Reluctance to forgive can come from a place of, I donâ€™t want to lose power. If I forgive this person, I have given them the power to keep hurting me because I pardoned them. But forgiveness can be the message: I donâ€™t condone what you did, but I give myself the gift of letting go of the hurt I carry and any bitterness I feel toward you, and I extend grace to you to free you of any guilt you feel and trust that you will do better from now on. When I ask for forgiveness, what I am asking for is another chance, so thatâ€™s what I believe of others. To be deprived by the people we hurt of another chance to do better is painful and itâ€™s also sin to withhold that chance from someone as imperfect as we are, when God being PERFECT does not withhold it from us.

Conviction is not condemnation. If the voice isnâ€™t steering you towards a better course by telling you how you can do better itâ€™s not of God, itâ€™s the devil. The devil will just tell you that you are hopeless and have no future, there wonâ€™t be any encouragement in it. Just a strong urge to give up. The devil cannot inspire hope. He has none himself.

Forgiveness is the power of God in us. Thatâ€™s an awesome thing to think about. People say speaking in tongues is true evidence of the Holy Spirit living within a believer, but I believe itâ€™s the ability to forgive. We were given grace when we were undeserving and to extend grace to those we deem undeserving of it is a strength we wouldnâ€™t have if not for God demonstrating it first.
